title: Liam Gallagher to be given inaugural Rock Icon award at EMAs
text:
The Rock Icon at Glastonbury this year (Picture: Samir Hussein/WireImage)

Liam Gallagher is to be named the first recipient of the Rock Icon award at the 2019 MTV European Music Awards on Sunday.

The former Oasis frontman is set to take to the stage with an Oasis and solo track at the EMAs, where Dua Lipa, Sofia Reyes and Pabllo Vittar are also performing at the event in Seville, Spain.

A post on the official Twitter account announced the news, writing: ‘Liam Gallagher is @mtvema’s 2019 Rock Icon. Watch the performance live on @mtv this Sunday November 3rd #mtvema.’

Liam being Liam, the singer shared the news in the most casual way possible, reposting the image on Twitter with his standard: ‘LG x.’

Oh Liam, never change.

The 47-year-old is also nominated for the Best Rock award, but it is his position as the winner of the inaugural Rock Icon accolade that is sure to sit best with him – especially as it means that he won the award before his estranged brother Noel.

However, it seems like Liam is taking a well deserved break from beefing with his older brother (at least for now) in order to *checks notes* fight Robbie Williams.

Yep, you heard that right.

The Rock DJ singer earlier this week challenged Liam to a pro-boxing battle, claiming that the pair could ‘trounce’ YouTube-stars-turned-boxers Logan Paul and KSI.

‘I’d love it. But I’d want it to be a professional fight. I’ve just seen how much KSI and Logan Paul made from their fight and I think we could trounce that,’ Robbie said.

‘But, yeah, I think last time in the noughties Liam wanted to go down to an abandoned railway track or something.

‘I don’t want to do that. It’s got to be f**king whistles and bells if it happens… Liam and I would be a wonderful thing.’

See, this is what hanging out with Tyson Fury does to you…
